author: dws
msg: * packages/rpm/subversion.spec : Took out svn_for_cvs_users.info as it
no longer exists. *sigh*....I'm a programmer; I ought to know that just
because it compiles and builds doesn't mean it's going to work.

author: dws
msg: Am I missing something or should this patch go in?  Rev 2558 broke the RPM
build because no more svn-manual.info file.  Please revert this patch or fix it
if I goofed on anything.
* build.conf : Took out old doc/user/manual/svn-manual.info and replaced
with new doc/handbook/svn-handbook.info* files.
* Makefile.in : Same.
* dist.sh : Same.
* packages/rpm/subversion.spec : Same.

author: dws
msg: * packages/rpm/subversion.spec : Take special code out to install svn-config
because it now installs with the normal install procedure as of rev 2556.

author: sussman
msg: Removing obsolete documentation (after first brushing away cobwebs.)
"Nobody goes in there, son..."
* doc/user/svnlook, doc/user/manual, doc/user/svn_for_cvs_users,
doc/user/quickref, doc/user/svn_intro: delete these old crufty
subdirectories.
* doc/user/lj_article.txt:  copied & renamed from doc/user/svn_intro/.
* doc/user/svn-ref.tex:  copied out from doc/user/quickref
* README:  update descriptions of our docs.

author: sussman
msg: What's that I hear?  Alpha around the corner?  Recently getting
slashdotted?  Dang it, we need a HANDBOOK.  Here, finally, is a
complete first draft that unifies all of our existing documentation
into one coherent outline, and fills in all the missing gaps as well.
Something for all the imminent newbies to chew on.  From now on, it's
RTFH.  :-)
* client.texi:  hoo, man, finish writing this chapter.
* getting_started.texi: add xref to appendix.  remove opening quote,
as it sets a hostile tone against CVS, and we're better sports than
that.
* appendices.texi:  shrink the SVN-for-CVS-users section down, since
much of it was ganked for the client chapter.  finish all the other
sections.
